question:
Consider the following statements about the Atal Innovation Mission (AIM):
  1. It has been set up by the NITI Aayog for transforming the innovation and entrepreneurship ecosystem in the country
  2. It aims to establish tinkering labs in schools to foster the creativity of students
  3. AIM possess the IP rights and patents for innovations found in the process
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) is the flagship initiative by the NITI Aayog to promote a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship in the country. AIM is mandated to create an umbrella structure to oversee innovation ecosystem of the country. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. The mission aims at establishing tinkering labs in schools to foster creativity of students. Tinkering labs are different from conventional science labs. Tinkering labs have equipments appropriate to the age of the intended students and are known for open-ended experiments. The corporates are partners of AIM in supporting the ATL initiative. <u>Third statement is incorrect</u>. AIM has no IP rights or patents for innovations.
